Class ServerClientCommon

  • java.lang.Object
    • ServerClientCommon

  • abstract class ServerClientCommon
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static java.lang.String CONTROL_MESSAGE_SPECIFIER
      This must be placed at the beginning of a client message in order to specify a control command.
      (package private) static java.lang.String DEFAULT_SERVER_HOSTNAME
      This program is expected to be run on eecslinab1.engineering.cwru.edu, so use this hostname as the default.
      (package private) static int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
      I'm in the 325N section and my roster number is 2 (so 46 + 2) This is the default port number for both the server and client.
      (package private) static java.lang.String DISCONNECT_FROM_SERVER
      This disconnects the client from the server.
      (package private) static java.lang.String GET_DELIMETER
      Have the server inform the client of its delimiter
      (package private) static java.lang.String GET_LIST_OF_CONNECTED_CLIENTS
      The server will return a comma separated list of clients currently attached to this server, by name.
      (package private) static java.lang.String GET_MY_NAME
      The server will return what it thinks this client's name is.
      (package private) static java.lang.String GET_MY_PEERS_NAME
      Get the name of the client that the client is chatting with
      (package private) static java.lang.String LISTENER_SPECIFIER
      As noted above, when the command "SET MY NAME=" has this string as the parameter, the client will disconnect from the current chat and enter listening mode.
      (package private) static java.lang.String[] RESERVED_NAMES
      Names that a client isn't allowed to take
      (package private) static java.lang.String SET_DELIMITER
      Used to specify the delimiter for the client.
      (package private) static java.lang.String SET_PEER_NAME
      Specify the name of the peer that a client wants to connect to.
      (package private) static java.lang.String SET_USERNAME
      Specify the name of the client.

        Specify the name of the client.
        See Also:

      • SET_PEER_NAME

        static final java.lang.String SET_PEER_NAME
        Specify the name of the peer that a client wants to connect to. Following this command, the server will attempt to connect this client to the desired peer. Specify "Listener" to disconnect with the current client if currently chatting with someone.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SET_DELIMITER

        static final java.lang.String SET_DELIMITER
        Used to specify the delimiter for the client. The delimiter breaks messages into multiple lines. "" means no delimiter.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GET_DELIMETER

        static final java.lang.String GET_DELIMETER
        Have the server inform the client of its delimiter
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISCONNECT_FROM_SERVER

        static final java.lang.String DISCONNECT_FROM_SERVER
        This disconnects the client from the server. The peer (if one exists at the time of calling) will be notified of the disconnection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GET_LIST_OF_CONNECTED_CLIENTS

        static final java.lang.String GET_LIST_OF_CONNECTED_CLIENTS
        The server will return a comma separated list of clients currently attached to this server, by name.

      • LISTENER_SPECIFIER

        static final java.lang.String LISTENER_SPECIFIER
        As noted above, when the command "SET MY NAME=" has this string as the parameter, the client will disconnect from the current chat and enter listening mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • closeSocket

        static void closeSocket(java.net.Socket socketToClose,
                        ChatClient client)
        Close the socket specified by the parameter.
        Parameters:
        socketToClose - The socket to close
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.

      • getSocketBufferedReader

        static java.io.BufferedReader getSocketBufferedReader(java.net.Socket connectionSocket,
                                                      ChatClient client)
        Parameters:
        connectionSocket - The socket to generate a BufferedReader from
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.
        Returns:
        A BufferedReader associated with the specified socket.

      • getSocketDataOutputStream

        static java.io.DataOutputStream getSocketDataOutputStream(java.net.Socket connectionSocket,
                                                          ChatClient client)
        Parameters:
        connectionSocket - The socket whose DataOutputStream is desired.
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.
        Returns:
        A DataOutputStream associated with the socket parameter

      • readFromSocket

        static java.lang.String readFromSocket(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                                       ChatClient client)
        Retrieve a line from the specified BufferedReader. readLine() is a blocking call.
        Parameters:
        reader - The buffered reader to read from
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.
        Returns:
        A string containing the current line of the parameter. If null, it means that the connection was terminated and that the caller should execute it's connection-break code.

      • sendMessageToDataOutputStream

        static void sendMessageToDataOutputStream(java.lang.String msgToSend,
                                          java.io.DataOutputStream stream,
                                          ChatClient client)
        Send a message to the DataOutputStream parameter. This is how inter-socket communication works. Client A messages the server through the DataOutputStream that the server reads, intending to message client B, and the server drops a message into Client B's DataOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        msgToSend - The message to send
        stream - The stream to write into.
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.

      • displayExceptionMessageForClientOrServer

        static void displayExceptionMessageForClientOrServer(java.lang.String otherMessage,
                                                     java.lang.Exception exc,
                                                     ChatClient client)
        This function is used to display a stack trace from either the client or server.
        Parameters:
        otherMessage - A string to print before the stack trace
        exc - The exception whose stack trace will be printed
        client - Null if the server is calling. Otherwise, the client param's exception message handler is called.

      • printExceptionMsgToConsole

        static void printExceptionMsgToConsole(java.lang.String otherMsg,
                                       java.lang.Exception except)
        Print an exception message and stack trace to the console.
        Parameters:
        otherMsg - A string to print before the stack trace
        except - The exception whose stack trace will be printed.
